t: Lamentations 1
The Sorrows of Zion

How*pn lonely sits the city That*ln was full of people! She*ln has become like a widow Who*ln was once*i great among the nations! She*ln who was a princess among the provinces Has*ln become a forced laborer!

She*ln weeps bitterly in the night And*ln her tears are on her cheeks; She*ln has none to comfort her Among*ln all her lovers. All*ln her friends have dealt treacherously with her; They*ln have become her enemies.

Judah*ln has gone into exile under affliction And*ln under harsh servitude; She*ln dwells among the nations, But*iln she has found no rest; All*ln her pursuers have overtaken her In*ln the midst of distress.

The*ln roads of Zion are in mourning Because*ln no one comes to the appointed feasts. All*ln her gates are desolate; Her*ln priests are groaning, Her*ln virgins are afflicted, And*ln she herself is bitter.

Her*ln adversaries have become her masters, Her*ln enemies prosper; For*ln the Lord*s has caused her grief Because*ln of the multitude of her transgressions; Her*ln little ones have gone away As*ln captives before the adversary.
All*ln her majesty Has*ln departed from the daughter of Zion; Her*ln princes have become like deer That*ln have found no pasture; And*ln they have fled without strength Before*ln the pursuer.

In*ln the days of her affliction and homelessness Jerusalem*ln remembers all her precious things That*ln were from the days of old, When*ln her people fell into the hand of the adversary And*ln no one helped her. The*ln adversaries saw her, They*ln mocked at her ruin.
Jerusalem*ln sinned greatly, Therefore*ln she has become an unclean thing. All*ln who honored her despise her Because*ln they have seen her nakedness; Even*ln she herself groans and turns away.

Her*ln uncleanness was in her skirts; She*ln did not consider her future. Therefore*ln she has fallen astonishingly; She*ln has no comforter. “See,*ln O Lord,*s my affliction, For*ln the enemy has magnified himself!”

The*ln adversary has stretched out his hand Over*ln all her precious things, For*ln she has seen the nations enter her sanctuary, The*ln ones whom You commanded That*ln they should not enter into Your congregation.
All*ln her people groan seeking bread; They*ln have given their precious things for food To*ln restore their lives themselves. “See,*ln O Lord,*s and look, For*ln I am despised.”
“Is*ln it nothing to all you who pass this way? Look*ln and see if there is any pain like my pain Which*ln was severely dealt out to me, Which*ln the Lord*s inflicted on the day of His fierce anger.
From*ln on high He sent fire into my bones, And*ln it prevailed over*i them.*i He*ln has spread a net for my feet; He*ln has turned me back; He*ln has made me desolate, Faint*ln all day long.

The*ln yoke of my transgressions is bound; By*ln His hand they are knit together. They*ln have come upon my neck; He*ln has made my strength fail. The*ln Lord has given me into the hands Of*ln those*i against*i whom*i I am not able to stand.

The*ln Lord has rejected all my strong men In*ln my midst; He*ln has called an appointed time against me To*ln crush my young men; The*ln Lord has trodden as*i in*i a wine press The*ln virgin daughter of Judah.
For*ln these things I weep; My*ln eyes run down with water; Because*ln far from me is a comforter, One*ln who restores my soul. My*ln children are desolate Because*ln the enemy has prevailed.”

Zion*ln stretches out her hands; There*ln is no one to comfort her; The*ln Lord*s has commanded concerning Jacob That*ln the ones round about him should be his adversaries; Jerusalem*ln has become an unclean thing among them.
“The*ln Lord*s is righteous; For*ln I have rebelled against His command; Hear*ln now, all peoples, And*ln behold my pain; My*ln virgins and my young men Have*ln gone into captivity.
I*ln called to my lovers, but*i they deceived me; My*ln priests and my elders perished in the city While*ln they sought food to restore their strength themselves.

See,*ln O Lord,*s for I am in distress; My*ln spirit is greatly troubled; My*ln heart is overturned within me, For*ln I have been very rebellious. In*ln the street the sword slays; In*ln the house it is like death.

They*ln have heard that I groan; There*ln is no one to comfort me; All*ln my enemies have heard of my calamity; They*ln are glad that You have done it.*i Oh,*ln that You would bring the day which You have proclaimed, That*ln they may become like me.
Let*ln all their wickedness come before You; And*ln deal with them as You have dealt with me For*ln all my transgressions; For*ln my groans are many and my heart is faint.”
Lamentations 2
God’s Anger over Israel

How*pn the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion With*ln a cloud in His anger! He*ln has cast from heaven to earth The*ln glory of Israel, And*ln has not remembered His footstool In*ln the day of His anger.

The*ln Lord has swallowed up; He has not spared All*ln the habitations of Jacob. In*ln His wrath He has thrown down The*ln strongholds of the daughter of Judah; He*ln has brought them*i down to the ground; He*ln has profaned the kingdom and its princes.

In*ln fierce anger He has cut off All*ln the strength of Israel; He*ln has drawn back His right hand From*ln before the enemy. And*ln He has burned in Jacob like a flaming fire Consuming*ln round about.

He*ln has bent His bow like an enemy; He*ln has set His right hand like an adversary And*ln slain all that were pleasant to the eye; In*ln the tent of the daughter of Zion He*ln has poured out His wrath like fire.

The*ln Lord has become like an enemy. He*ln has swallowed up Israel; He*ln has swallowed up all its palaces, He*ln has destroyed its strongholds And*ln multiplied in the daughter of Judah Mourning*ln and moaning.

And*ln He has violently treated His tabernacle like a garden booth;*i He*ln has destroyed His appointed meeting place. The*ln Lord*s has caused to be forgotten The*ln appointed feast and sabbath in Zion, And*ln He has despised king and priest In*ln the indignation of His anger.

The*ln Lord has rejected His altar, He*ln has abandoned His sanctuary; He*ln has delivered into the hand of the enemy The*ln walls of her palaces. They*ln have made a noise in the house of the Lord*s As*ln in the day of an appointed feast.

The*ln Lord*s determined to destroy The*ln wall of the daughter of Zion. He*ln has stretched out a line, He*ln has not restrained His hand from destroying, And*ln He has caused rampart and wall to lament; They*ln have languished together.

Her*ln gates have sunk into the ground, He*ln has destroyed and broken her bars. Her*ln king and her princes are among the nations; The*ln law is no more. Also,*ln her prophets find No*ln vision from the Lord.*s

The*ln elders of the daughter of Zion Sit*ln on the ground, they are silent. They*ln have thrown dust on their heads; They*ln have girded themselves with sackcloth. The*ln virgins of Jerusalem Have*ln bowed their heads to the ground.

My*ln eyes fail because of tears, My*ln spirit is greatly troubled; My*ln heart is poured out on the earth Because*ln of the destruction of the daughter of my people, When*ln little ones and infants faint In*ln the streets of the city.
They*ln say to their mothers, “Where*ln is grain and wine?” As*ln they faint like a wounded man In*ln the streets of the city, As*ln their life is poured out On*ln their mothers’ bosom.

How*ln shall I admonish you? To*ln what shall I compare you, O*ln daughter of Jerusalem? To*ln what shall I liken you as I comfort you, O*ln virgin daughter of Zion? For*ln your ruin is as vast as the sea; Who*ln can heal you?

Your*ln prophets have seen for you False*ln and foolish visions;*i And*ln they have not exposed your iniquity So*ln as to restore you from captivity, But*ln they have seen for you false and misleading oracles.

All*ln who pass along the way Clap*ln their hands in*i derision*i at you; They*ln hiss and shake their heads At*ln the daughter of Jerusalem, “Is*ln this the city of which they said, ‘The*ln perfection of beauty, A*ln joy to all the earth’?”

All*ln your enemies Have*ln opened their mouths wide against you; They*ln hiss and gnash their*i teeth. They*ln say, “We have swallowed her*i up! Surely*ln this is the day for which we waited; We*ln have reached it,*i we have seen it.”*i

The*ln Lord*s has done what He purposed; He*ln has accomplished His word Which*ln He commanded from days of old. He*ln has thrown down without sparing, And*ln He has caused the enemy to rejoice over you; He*ln has exalted the might of your adversaries.
Their*ln heart cried out to the Lord, “O*ln wall of the daughter of Zion, Let*ln your*i tears run down like a river day and night; Give*ln yourself no relief, Let*ln your eyes have no rest.

Arise,*ln cry aloud in the night At*ln the beginning of the night watches; Pour*ln out your heart like water Before*ln the presence of the Lord; Lift*ln up your hands to Him For*ln the life of your little ones Who*ln are faint because of hunger At*ln the head of every street.”

See,*ln O Lord,*s and look! With*ln whom have You dealt thus? Should*ln women eat their offspring, The*ln little ones who were born healthy? Should*ln priest and prophet be slain In*ln the sanctuary of the Lord?

On*ln the ground in the streets Lie*ln young and old; My*ln virgins and my young men Have*ln fallen by the sword. You*ln have slain them*i in the day of Your anger, You*ln have slaughtered, not sparing.

You*ln called as in the day of an appointed feast My*ln terrors on every side; And*ln there was no one who escaped or survived In*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger. Those*ln whom I bore and reared, My*ln enemy annihilated them.
Lamentations 3
Jeremiah Shares Israel’s Affliction
I*pn am the man who has seen affliction Because*ln of the rod of His wrath.
He*ln has driven me and made me walk In*ln darkness and not in light.
Surely*ln against me He has turned His hand Repeatedly*ln all the day.
He*ln has caused my flesh and my skin to waste away, He*ln has broken my bones.
He*ln has besieged and encompassed me with bitterness and hardship.
In*ln dark places He has made me dwell, Like*ln those who have long been dead.
He*ln has walled me in so that I cannot go out; He*ln has made my chain heavy.
Even*ln when I cry out and call for help, He*ln shuts out my prayer.
He*ln has blocked my ways with hewn stone; He*ln has made my paths crooked.
He*ln is to me like a bear lying in wait, Like*iln a lion in secret places.
He*ln has turned aside my ways and torn me to pieces; He*ln has made me desolate.
He*ln bent His bow And*ln set me as a target for the arrow.
He*ln made the arrows of His quiver To*ln enter into my inward parts.
I*ln have become a laughingstock to all my people, Their*ln mocking*i song all the day.
He*ln has filled me with bitterness, He*ln has made me drunk with wormwood.
He*ln has broken my teeth with gravel; He*ln has made me cower in the dust.
My*ln soul has been rejected from peace; I*ln have forgotten happiness.
So*ln I say, “My strength has perished, And*ln so*i has*i my hope from the Lord.”*s
Hope of Relief in God’s Mercy
Remember*pn my affliction and my wandering, the wormwood and bitterness.
Surely*ln my soul remembers And*ln is bowed down within me.
This*ln I recall to my mind, Therefore*ln I have hope.
The*ln Lord’s*s lovingkindnesses indeed never cease, For*ln His compassions never fail.
They*iln are new every morning; Great*ln is Your faithfulness.
“The*ln Lord*s is my portion,” says my soul, “Therefore*ln I have hope in Him.”
The*ln Lord*s is good to those who wait for Him, To*ln the person who seeks Him.
It*iln is*i good that he waits silently For*ln the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*iln is*i good for a man that he should bear The*ln yoke in his youth.
Let*ln him sit alone and be silent Since*ln He has laid it*i on him.
Let*ln him put his mouth in the dust, Perhaps*ln there is hope.
Let*ln him give his cheek to the smiter, Let*ln him be filled with reproach.
For*ln the Lord will not reject forever,
For*ln if He causes grief, Then*ln He will have compassion According*ln to His abundant lovingkindness.
For*ln He does not afflict willingly Or*ln grieve the sons of men.
To*ln crush under His feet All*ln the prisoners of the land,
To*ln deprive a man of justice In*ln the presence of the Most High,
To*ln defraud a man in his lawsuit— Of*ln these things the Lord does not approve.
Who*ln is there who speaks and it comes to pass, Unless*ln the Lord has commanded it?*i
Is*iln it*i not from the mouth of the Most High That*ln both good and ill go forth?
Why*ln should any*i living mortal, or any*i man, Offer*ln complaint in view of his sins?
Let*ln us examine and probe our ways, And*ln let us return to the Lord.*s
We*ln lift up our heart and hands Toward*ln God in heaven;
We*ln have transgressed and rebelled, You*ln have not pardoned.
You*ln have covered Yourself*i with anger And*ln pursued us; You*ln have slain and*i have not spared.
You*ln have covered Yourself with a cloud So*ln that no prayer can pass through.
You*iln have*i made*i us*i mere*i offscouring and refuse In*ln the midst of the peoples.
All*ln our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
Panic*ln and pitfall have befallen us, Devastation*ln and destruction;
My*ln eyes run down with streams of water Because*ln of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
My*ln eyes pour down unceasingly, Without*ln stopping,
Until*ln the Lord*s looks down And*ln sees from heaven.
My*ln eyes bring pain to my soul Because*ln of all the daughters of my city.
My*ln enemies without cause Hunted*ln me down like a bird;
They*ln have silenced me in the pit And*ln have placed a stone on me.
Waters*ln flowed over my head; I*ln said, “I am cut off!”
I*ln called on Your name, O Lord,*s Out*ln of the lowest pit.
You*ln have heard my voice, “Do*ln not hide Your ear from my prayer*i for*i relief, From*ln my cry for help.”
You*ln drew near when I called on You; You*ln said, “Do not fear!”
O*ln Lord, You have pleaded my soul’s cause; You*ln have redeemed my life.
O*ln Lord,*s You have seen my oppression; Judge*ln my case.
You*ln have seen all their vengeance, All*ln their schemes against me.
You*ln have heard their reproach, O Lord,*s All*ln their schemes against me.
The*ln lips of my assailants and their whispering Are*iln against me all day long.
Look*ln on their sitting and their rising; I*ln am their mocking song.
You*ln will recompense them, O Lord,*s According*ln to the work of their hands.
You*ln will give them hardness of heart, Your*ln curse will be on them.
You*ln will pursue them in anger and destroy them From*ln under the heavens of the Lord!*s
Lamentations 4
Distress of the Siege Described
How*pn dark the gold has become, How*iln the pure gold has changed! The*ln sacred stones are poured out At*ln the corner of every street.
The*ln precious sons of Zion, Weighed*ln against fine gold, How*ln they are regarded as earthen jars, The*ln work of a potter’s hands!
Even*ln jackals offer the breast, They*ln nurse their young; But*iln the daughter of my people has become cruel Like*ln ostriches in the wilderness.
The*ln tongue of the infant cleaves To*ln the roof of its mouth because of thirst; The*ln little ones ask for bread, But*iln no one breaks it*i for them.
Those*ln who ate delicacies Are*ln desolate in the streets; Those*ln reared in purple Embrace*ln ash pits.
For*ln the iniquity of the daughter of my people Is*ln greater than the sin of Sodom, Which*ln was overthrown as in a moment, And*ln no hands were turned toward her.
Her*ln consecrated ones were purer than snow, They*ln were whiter than milk; They*ln were more ruddy in*i body than corals, Their*ln polishing was*i like*i lapis lazuli.
Their*ln appearance is blacker than soot, They*ln are not recognized in the streets; Their*ln skin is shriveled on their bones, It*ln is withered, it has become like wood.
Better*ln are those slain with the sword Than*ln those slain with hunger; For*ln they pine away, being stricken For*ln lack of the fruits of the field.
The*ln hands of compassionate women Boiled*ln their own children; They*ln became food for them Because*ln of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The*ln Lord*s has accomplished His wrath, He*ln has poured out His fierce anger; And*ln He has kindled a fire in Zion Which*ln has consumed its foundations.
The*ln kings of the earth did not believe, Nor*ln did*i any of the inhabitants of the world, That*ln the adversary and the enemy Could*ln enter the gates of Jerusalem.
Because*ln of the sins of her prophets And*iln the iniquities of her priests, Who*ln have shed in her midst The*ln blood of the righteous;
They*ln wandered, blind, in the streets; They*ln were defiled with blood So*ln that no one could touch their garments.
“Depart!*ln Unclean!” they cried of themselves. “Depart,*ln depart, do not touch!” So*ln they fled and wandered; Men*iln among the nations said, “They*ln shall not continue to dwell with*i us.”*i
The*ln presence of the Lord*s has scattered them, He*ln will not continue to regard them; They*ln did not honor the priests, They*ln did not favor the elders.
Yet*ln our eyes failed, Looking*iln for help was useless; In*ln our watching we have watched For*ln a nation that could not save.
They*ln hunted our steps So*ln that we could not walk in our streets; Our*ln end drew near, Our*ln days were finished For*ln our end had come.
Our*ln pursuers were swifter Than*ln the eagles of the sky; They*ln chased us on the mountains, They*ln waited in ambush for us in the wilderness.
The*ln breath of our nostrils, the Lord’s*s anointed, Was*ln captured in their pits, Of*ln whom we had said, “Under his shadow We*ln shall live among the nations.”
Rejoice*ln and be glad, O daughter of Edom, Who*ln dwells in the land of Uz; But*iln the cup will come around to you as well, You*ln will become drunk and make yourself naked.
The*iln punishment*i of your iniquity has been completed, O daughter of Zion; He*ln will exile you no longer. But*iln He will punish your iniquity, O daughter of Edom; He*ln will expose your sins!
Lamentations 5
A Prayer for Mercy
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s what has befallen us; Look,*ln and see our reproach!
Our*ln inheritance has been turned over to strangers, Our*ln houses to aliens.
We*ln have become orphans without a father, Our*ln mothers are like widows.
We*ln have to pay for our drinking water, Our*ln wood comes to*i us*i at a price.
Our*ln pursuers are at our necks; We*ln are worn out, there is no rest for us.
We*ln have submitted to Egypt and*i Assyria to get enough bread.
Our*ln fathers sinned, and*i are no more; It*ln is we who have borne their iniquities.
Slaves*ln rule over us; There*ln is no one to deliver us from their hand.
We*ln get our bread at the risk of our lives Because*ln of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin has become as hot as an oven, Because*ln of the burning heat of famine.
They*ln ravished the women in Zion, The*ln virgins in the cities of Judah.
Princes*ln were hung by their hands; Elders*ln were not respected.
Young*ln men worked at the grinding mill, And*ln youths stumbled under loads*i of wood.
Elders*ln are gone from the gate, Young*ln men from their music.
The*ln joy of our hearts has ceased; Our*ln dancing has been turned into mourning.
The*ln crown has fallen from our head; Woe*ln to us, for we have sinned!
Because*ln of this our heart is faint, Because*ln of these things our eyes are dim;
Because*ln of Mount Zion which lies desolate, Foxes*ln prowl in it.
You,*ln O Lord,*s rule forever; Your*ln throne is from generation to generation.
Why*ln do You forget us forever? Why*ln do You forsake us so long?
Restore*ln us to You, O Lord,*s that we may be restored; Renew*ln our days as of old,
Unless*ln You have utterly rejected us And*iln are exceedingly angry with us.
